page.title: 19Local History
page.content: Lord Armstrong the great engineer and creator of the Cragside estate near Rothbury once owned Netherton Southside Netherton Burnfoot and Netherton Mill farms.He developed water energy units at thm similar to those at Cragside(supposedly the first house in Britain to be lit by electric light).The water sources were respctively a pond formed behind the farm, a dam built across the river and a water channel built from a spring on Elilaw farm. The power was generated by a turbine in the farm buildings.There is still evidence of the water sources but not of the turbines and machinery driven by them.
